pr_title: Abstract REST Data resource and entity info

timeline.bodyText: @FroMage could you verify that this is a correct way to get a setter?
timeline.author: gytis
FroMage

replies.bodyText:
Initially I tried this
return MethodDescriptor.ofMethod(
    entityClass.toString(), 
    JavaBeanUtil.getSetterName(field.name()), 
    void.class, 
    field.type().toString());
Which in my test was
return MethodDescriptor.ofMethod(
    "io.quarkus.hibernate.orm.rest.data.panache.deployment.entity.Item", 
    "setId", 
    void.class, 
    "java.lang.Long");
and it was be called as a virtual method. But I ended up getting
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 'void io.quarkus.hibernate.orm.rest.data.panache.deployment.entity.Item.setId(java.lang.Long)'
replies.author: gytis

replies.bodyText: This is weird, this setter should exist.
replies.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText:
I've changed this bit to use the ID type specified in the generic instead of field.type() (e.g. Long in this case public interface ItemsController extends PanacheEntityResource<Item, Long>). And I've added and extra abstract class to verify that the scenario you gave above with IdType works too.
However, I still get NoSuchMethodException unless I use EnhancerConstants.PERSISTENT_FIELD_WRITER_PREFIX so I kept it there.
replies.author: gytis

replies.bodyText: OK, so what throws? I bet it's using reflection on the non-instrumented class.
replies.author: FroMage
